thread.title: Passenger claims hit Jet2 owner’s annual profits
thread.title_full: Passenger claims hit Jet2 owner’s annual profits

title: Passenger claims hit Jet2 owner’s annual profits
text:
Save 
The parent company of Jet2.com and Jet2holidays has reported a 32% fall in operating profit thanks to a £17m provision for possible passenger claims from flight delays. 
Operating profit fell from £49.2 million to £33.6 million for the year ending March 31, 2015. But by stripping out the exceptional cost the underlying result actually rose by 3% to £50.6 million. 
The group’s package holiday division continues to grow with 1 million people (+20%) now using the company. The figure represents a third of the overall number of customers. 
Group turnover rose 12% to £1.3 billion with leisure travel turnover up 14% to £1.1 billion. 
According to the company 52% of Jet2holidays packages are sold direct via the website, 17% via the call centre and the rest via high street and online travel agents. 
Leisure airline Jet2.com now flies 217 routes up from 205 in the previous year. 
The company expects to continue its growth in the current financial year. 
“Notwithstanding the tragedy in Tunisia and uncertainties in Greece, we are optimistic that Group performance for the financial year to 31 March 2016 will exceed current market expectations,” said chairman Philip Meeson.
